page.title: 06BRANT BROUGHTON VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The village hall, which is chiefly a wooden building with a brick base, is situated in the middle of the village. It was moved from Cranwell at the end of the 1914-18 war.Clubs meet there, entertainment is put on and fund-raising efforts and wedding receptions are held.Some villagers were asked questions about the hall. Most people only use the hall a few times a year although some go there at least once a month. Most people go either for the doctor's surgery or to watch entertainment. Only one person interviewed goes more frequently since the alterations have been completed. Asked what they would like to see happening at the village hall, people made the following suggestions: more entertainment, whist drives and more activities for children. All thought the hall an asset to the village.
